name: Description
format:
Plug and Produce Architecture: Produce process

Our proposal of the Produce part of the PnPr architecture is presented in Fig. At the top, in the green rectangle with dashed line, are the (5) steps of Produce, which can be interpreted from left to right: communicate (6), select (7), analyze (8), compose (9) and manage (10). At the bottom of the green rectangle with dashed line in Fig., the number of steps is associated with their specific functions in the PnPr architecture, maintaining the same numbering.

CRUD Methods
info:
CRUD Methods (Create, Read, Update and Delete)


Registry â€“ A centralized storage object that holds dynamic variables, configurations, and other essential application data. 
It serves as a single source of truth for managing runtime settings, environment parameters, and metadata, allowing seamless access and updates across different components of the application. 
The Registry ensures consistency, flexibility, and maintainability by providing a structured way to store and retrieve critical information.

name: Options
func:
msg.payload = {
  op1: Math.floor(Math.random() * 100),
  op2: 11 + Math.floor(Math.random() * 10),
  op3: Math.floor(Math.random() * 50),
  op4: Math.floor(Math.random() * 75),
  op5: Math.floor(Math.random() * 30),
  op6: Math.floor(Math.random() * 20),
  op7: Math.floor(Math.random() * 99),
  op8: Math.floor(Math.random() * 80),
  op9: Math.floor(Math.random() * 60),
  op10: Math.floor(Math.random() * 40),
  sensor: global.get("registry.sensor.aas.idShortAsset"),
  sensorValue: global.get("registry.sensor.aas.value"),
  controller: global.get("registry.controller.aas.idShortAsset"),
  actuator: global.get("registry.actuator.aas.idShortAsset")
};


return msg;

name: Applications
Description
format:
Communication Step

A total integrated networked environment is one of the Industry 4.0 pillars. Creating Industry 4.0 applications in the Produce part requires a standardized and automatic communication among assets. The sixth step in the Produce process, as depicted in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (highlighted in green), involves utilizing service composer software compatible with the asset communication protocol and their respective information models of the PnPr architecture to establish a communication channel for creating automation applications.

In our proposal, Node-RED was chosen as the composer due to its industry acceptance and communication support for our PnPr architecture (microservice, OPC UA, and HTTP). In this stage, a call is made every 10 seconds to register Moleculer services. The response includes all available and online assets connected to the NATS transporter.

Key Service Returns:

  • $node.list: Lists all known nodes
  • $node.services: Lists all registered services
  • $node.actions: Lists all registered actions

Technical Note:

The communication layer automatically handles service discovery and registration through the NATS transporter, enabling seamless integration between assets in the PnPr architecture.

name: Description
format:
Selection Step

The seventh step in the Produce process, as illustrated in in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (highlighted in green), involves application composers issuing a scanner request to detect all available assets within the network. Upon receiving the response - which includes asset properties, capacities, and other structured information according to the Asset Administration Shell (AAS) information model - the data can be systematically organized into an Asset Library, as shown in in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab.

In our implementation, we utilize the Node Package Manager (NPM) to encapsulate and distribute custom-created libraries and functional blocks within the Node-RED development environment (editor/backend). Additionally, you can dynamically select online assets using the interactive selectors below through the Node-RED dashboard (frontend) interface.

Instructions:

  1. Select a Sensor Asset (e.g., lit125_daq)
  2. Select a Controller Asset (e.g., lic125_pid4)
  3. Select an Actuator Asset (e.g., p2_daq)
  4. Proceed to the next step: 8-Analyze

name: Description analyze
format:
Analysis Step

In the eighth step in Produce in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (highlighted in green), the compositor analyzes the identity, functionalities, and requirements of the asset(s). The asset manager data structure in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (E.g., Motor) supports the representation of the physical and the information world, allowing the change of asset parameters, as well as the creation of asset simulation models for enabling the creation of Digital Twins (DT)

At this stage, it is possible to change all the settings of the blocks you selected either in Node-RED (editor/backend) statically or dynamically (dashboard/frontend).

Instructions:

  1. Analyze and configure the sensor asset value if needed. Example: "idShortSubmodel": "OperationalData", "idShortSubmodelElement": "Percentage", "format": "value"
  2. Analyze and configure the controller asset value if needed. Example: {"idShortSubmodel": "OperationalData", "idShortSubmodelElement": "Parameters", "format": "value", "value": {"ti": 17, "td": 2, "kp": 7.5}}
  3. Analyze and configure the actuator asset value if needed. Example: {"idShortSubmodel": "OperationalData", "idShortSubmodelElement": "Percentage", "format": "value"}
  4. Proceed to the next step: 9-Compose

name: Description compose
format:
Compose Step

Industrial service-oriented applications mostly rely on the orchestration procedure. The ninth step in Produce in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (highlighted in green) is related to the composition of applications in the PnPr architecture. As in an "orchestra", the composer defines a sequence in which the assets will relate, composing the required application in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (Asset Composer).

At this stage, you can compose an application manually in the backend, or select applications that have already been developed and have pre-configured parameters.

Instructions:

  1. Select the generic application you want to run from the menu. Example: Process Control
  2. Click on the control loop you want to use. Example: Tank Level
  3. Proceed to the next step: 10-Manage

name: Description manage
format:
Management Step

The tenth and last step in Produce in the architecture PnPr figure in the Produce tab (highlighted in green) occurs after defining the order in the asset's composition. The execution of the application can occur manually, where each step of the program is controlled and initiated by the user. Furthermore, there is automatic execution, where the program is configured to operate autonomously, without direct user intervention. Actions are performed according to a set of predefined instructions or rules.

At this stage, you can manage the application. You can start or stop the application, as well as view control statistics. You can also export graph data.

Instructions:

  1. Click Start/On to begin the application
  2. If you want to collect data, configure the number of samples you need. Example: 1000 samples
  3. Click Start/On Recording to begin data collection
  4. After finishing the recording, click Download TXT to save the control chart data
  5. If you want to stop the application, click Stop/Off

url
format:
<script>
    (function(scope) {
    let ultimaUrl = null;

    scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) {
        if (
            msg &&
            msg.trigger === true &&
            typeof msg.payload === 'string' &&
            msg.payload.startsWith('http://186.217.146.208:18105/Export_SpxPv') &&
            msg.payload !== ultimaUrl
        ) {
            ultimaUrl = msg.payload;
            window.open(msg.payload, '_blank');

            // limpa o conteÃºdo para nÃ£o reutilizar em outro momento
            setTimeout(function() {
                scope.send({ reset: true });
            }, 500); // dÃ¡ um pequeno delay pro link abrir primeiro
        }
    });
})(scope);
</script>

})(scope);
</script>

name: trigger_export
Description
format: Portainer is an open-source graphical user interface designed to simplify the administration of Docker environments. With Portainer, users get an intuitive, centralized view of their Docker containers, images, volumes, and networks, making it easy to manage complex environments in a visual and accessible way.

name: Description
format: AASX Server is a companion application to AASX Package Explorer. It provides a local service to host and serve AAS packages. The Core version exposes endpoints for REST, OPC UA and MQTT protocols. The GUI version offers the same functionality and additionally uses Blazor Framework to provide a GUI in the browser for exploring AASX Packages.

name: Create registry
Read registry object
func:
var registry = global.get("registry") || {};
return { payload: registry };

name: Read Specific Variable
Update Speed Sensor
Toggle Headlights
Delete registry object
func:

return { payload: "registry deleted!" };

CRUD Methods
info:
CRUD Methods (Create, Read, Update and Delete)


Registry â€“ A centralized storage object that holds dynamic variables, configurations, and other essential application data. 
It serves as a single source of truth for managing runtime settings, environment parameters, and metadata, allowing seamless access and updates across different components of the application. 
The Registry ensures consistency, flexibility, and maintainability by providing a structured way to store and retrieve critical information.
